Key Arguments: The bill threatens free speech and democracy.
It could silence debate and dissenting opinions.
The legislation may lead to manipulation of public opinion and pave the way for totalitarian power.
Debate is essential for exposing untruths and broadening perceptions.
The bill represents a misuse of authority and is a significant threat to free speech.
Notable Quotes: Democracy is built on free speech and this bill threatens the very essence of it.
With this bill, and without free speech, Australia will be a modern-day dictatorship.
